data.title: A Great Value
data.text:
My family and I stayed here for three nights recently. I was very pleased. The property is well kept. The rooms look to have been newly updated and were very clean and comfortable. The WiFi was fast and the TV large with many more channels than you usually find in a motel in this price range. Water pressure in the shower was a little weak but we never ran out of hot water. 
The property is on a busy street and, not surprisingly, next to a railroad track. If you are bothered by street noise this isn't for you. Our rooms were toward the back of the property and the noise wasn't very noticeable and didn't bother us at all.
The staff was friendly and seemed eager that we had an enjoyable stay.
I would not hesitate to stay here again. It's a great bargain

data.title: Surprisingly wonderful!
data.text: I wasn't expecting the best because of some reviews I had read.  However, I was impressed with the cleanliness of this hotel.  I stayed in a smoking king room and it was $90 for a Saturday night, not too bad.  Even though it was a smoking room, it didn't smell bad like most other smoking rooms I've stayed in.  The sheets and towels were clean as well as the floor and entire bathroom.  I'd stay here again if I was in the area.

data.title: Nice room for a good price
data.text:
My boyfriend and I stayed here last Saturday (10/28) while we were visiting Six Flags. The room we got was really nice and clean, the only problem was that it wasn't ready on time. The website says check-in is at 1 pm but the guy at the front desk said it was after 2 pm. We left Six Flags and showed up to the hotel a little before 2 pm and they told us our room wasn't ready and it'd be another 40 minutes. We went to grab some lunch, gave them over an hour to finish up but it still wasn't ready. Had to wait another 20 minutes when we got back. By the time we got settled in the room, it was around 4 pm, so we went back to Six Flags to enjoy the rest of the day. 

Aside from the room not being ready on time, another thing was the noise from the outside. You could hear everything, it sounded like the door was wide open. But honestly it wasn't that big of a deal because we just slept with the TV on that night.

Overall I would stay here again, as long as the room is ready on time.

data.title: You WILL need earplugs!
data.text:
I love budget motels, and finding a good one is like going on a treasure hunt. That said, I have 4 criteria: Is it clean, is it comfortable, is it safe, and is it quiet?
The Santa Clarita Motel is a great find: it is close to everything in the SCV. It is family-owned, I found the proprietors friendly and helpful, and I got a great price for 5 days through booking.com. The refrigerator in the room was a real plus since it helped me store food and save on meals. There is fresh coffee and a sweet roll in the office. I was able to swap my 2-bed room upstairs for a one-bed room downstairs. The bed was comfortable, the linens were clean. There were no bugs or cobwebs in the window sills or curtains. 
The only downside is the traffic noise. Railroad Avenue is extremely busy, even at night, and you will hear every bus, truck, car and motorcycle that goes by. And the railroad is across the street. It was the most noise I have ever heard at a motel. Short of replacing the windows with soundproof ones, the only other remedy is earplugs, which I purchased from CVS down the street and used the duration of my stay.

If noise doesnt bother you, this is a great little motel for the price. If noise is an issue, keep looking.

data.title: Very nice place
data.text: very nice place to spent your stay near LA, the motel is clean, people are friendly and helpful, free Wi-Fi access and rooms is new you just need to book you ream ahead of time because it's on high demand.

data.title: It does what it says on the tin
data.text:
We arrived late at night and the manager was very patient in getting us checked in. We had two rooms that were on opposite sides of the motel but both were big enough and had two double beds in each. The rooms were clean but looked a little tired. The bathroom was the same. Everything worked fine.
There was a train track next to the motel and you could hear the train but it was not sufficiently loud or often to give me a bad night's sleep.
If you need somewhere to simply stay for a night before or after hitting Six Flags theme park then I would recommend here. Overall it is good value and it is fine for a night.

owner_response.author: MICK P, Manager at Santa Clarita Motel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,
We thank you for choosing Santa Clarita Motel for your stay. We tremendously appreciate you for taking your time in reviewing us, your reviews are very important for us as it allows us to ensure your stay pleasant while at Santa Clarita Motel. I agree, train track noise could surprise you however it's not loud which can disturb your sleep. We highly suggest our light sleeper guest to ask us for a room towards the end if available. staff will continue to work hard to ensure your future stays with us are pleasant.
Best Regards,
Mick P
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: If you want to sleep, don't stay here.
data.text: Booked this motel based on reviews, needed a one night stay on the way to Yosemite. We didn't sleep. While others mention train noise, not many mention the fact that this motel is on a VERY busy road AND basically on top of a busy train line. It may have been ok if the doors of the motel room we had didn't fit. We could see light around 3 sides of the door and heard every.little.thing happening outside. The room was so-so, very old place and they try to make it nice inside. Lipstick on a pig sort of thing. One wi-fi password for each guest so if you have a phone and a tablet, only one can be on wi-fi. I've had better stays at Motel 6's and would never stay here again, especially for $99 bucks a night. Go elsewhere.

data.title: Crash time after a long flight
data.text: We got back from our trip from Europe after a delay in New York due to weather. We arrived at LAX around 2am and decided to rent a car to drive home rather than waiting for a flight to Sacramento. After getting out on the road for awhile we made it to Santa Clarita. Our first stop was the Santa Clarita motel where the staff was less than helpful in providing lodging. We won't be stopping again. No one ever came to the desk and when we called we know the staff was there but they never came out. So much for customer service

data.title: Excellent value, close to six flags!
data.text:
We stayed as a couple for one night, with the intention of visiting six flags the following day (which is very conveniently located close by). The property management was very friendly, the bed was large and comfortable. We paid a small extra fee to have a king sized bed but it was well worth it. There was some noise from trains but no whistles since there were no nearby crossings. The air conditioning was quite powerful, it quickly made the room cool, with a quiet mode to operate whilst sleeping.

Overall I was very pleased with the cleanliness and tasteful decor of the room; it looked much better than we were expecting for such an affordable price. We would gladly stay here again!

data.title: OK Motel for a pit stop.
data.text:
Stayed two nights, first night arrived late and was difficult to find a car space. Check in was quick and easy, coffee machine and some pastries in the reception for breakfast. Room was a good size (King room) however the bed was very uncomfortable, sheets almost felt they were plastic. Also a lot of noise from the road and train outside, almost sounded like the windows were open. Wifi worked ok.
A short five minute drive and you are near Lyons Ave which has a heap of shops and restaurants and main street every Thursday night has some free entertainment.

data.title: comfortable, clean and inexpensive motel
data.text:
Drove in late at night to check in, a very helpful man, Nick, explained where to go and what to see as I only landed at LAX that evening. The room was on the first floor and facing east. Lovely space, clean and safe, with a fridge and a bathtub. Daily service available, ample car park space and easy access to the motorway made my stay pleasurable. Large double bed and a corner sofa were very comfortable. Good price for the quality, will definitely book again with them. Laundromat adjacent.
Please note I travelled in Novmber 2014!

data.title: Great place, good value
data.text: Everything was fine. Check in went smoothly with nice staff.   Clean room, good size room.  helpful staff..  Good location to go to 6 Flags.  But  Must have your own car.   Only bummer was no pool.  Took the family here.  all good.

data.title: GREAT FOR AN OVERNIGHT
data.text: The room was clean, the bed comfortable.  The AC worked well and was not noisy.  The bathroom was very nice, reminded me of Roman and Greek bathes I saw at the Getty Villa.  There are more rooms than parking spaces, so if you arrive while parking is available I would recommend you stay in for the night or be prepared to park on the street. If you have to park on the street be sure you are 15 Ft from the fire hydrant, and 15 Ft away from the motel's drive way.  Being very close to the curb is also a good idea. The WiFi was free and it had a good signal.   There were a number of trains going by during the night, but thank goodness there was no crossing near by so no whistles. I'm not sure if the California and Washington fire codes are the same but in Washington having a refrigerator and a microwave plugged into a power strip is not up to code if it's done on a permanent basis.  We were only there for two nights so this may have been a temporary solution.

data.title: Older place, but nice rooms
data.text: Not too far from LA, and a heck of a lot less expensive.  Rooms were tastefully decorated, clean, and comfortable.  They had a good size refrigerator and a microwave, but no coffee pot.  At 7 am, you could go to the office and get a cup along with a packaged danish. We had a downstairs room and could hear the person above walking around, but that didn't last too long.  Shower worked well, bed was okay, pillow was more comfortable than it looked like it might be.  Would certainly stay here again. There was free WiFi, but the wifi code lasts only 24 hours and is per room.  Bring your reading glasses to see the code!

data.title: Good motel for the price
data.text: Close to Six Flags. You can tell the the onsite manager cares about his motel and the guests that stay in it. We had an issue with our room and he was quick to resolve it. The rooms are clean and up to date. The rooms closest to the road are a bit noisy so if you can request a room away from the road. We heard a train rumble by 2-3 times a night so the train tracks are not overly busy at night.

data.title: Nice, good upkeep
data.text:
Older property but well managed.  Some noise from railroad tracks.

Mattress seems replaced recently.  Wifi & 40" color tv in the room.   No coffee maker, but frig, freezer and microwave in the room!  Nice place, I shall return.
No breakfast served.

data.title: Out of LA...
data.text: Old style horseshoe shaped motel. Stayed overnight just to get out of LA and continuing to SF. Blinds don't keep out light. Beds are somewhat soft. Redecorated nicely but a bit sloppy. All floors are hard surfaced. Good space usage. Not a quiet place. Next to a four lane highway next to a railroad. Heard all of it at night. TIP: get as far back away from road as possible. Air Micro Fridge all worked well. Parking is tight. Highly secure WiFi. Good for quick overnight. $88 for 2 seniors incl. tax.

data.title: NOISY
data.text: Price is right. Nice decor. But, right next to a busy street. They need to update windows to make the rooms a little quieter. We can see daylight all the way around our door. Weather stripping might help soundproof too. No coffee in room. No breakfast. Great, secure wifi. No restaurants within walking distance.

data.title: Value for money
data.text:
Stayed here for 2 nights recently for a trip to Magic Mountain. The room was spacious, had a refrigerator and microwave, decent selection of TV channels and was clean. All staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful and the free wifi was very good (although I was only using it on my phone). 
The only downside is that it's not near a lot food wise, but they do have delivery options which are very reasonably priced. Also the trains and traffic can be a little noisy but I slept fine. For the $75ish per night I payed I was very happy with my accommodation, would definitely recommend for a cheap option near Six Flags.

data.title: They can't help the location
data.text: The rooms were nicely updated and clean, but no coffee pot.  But we should have gotten a clue from the street name, Railroad Ave., it has traffic and trains.  Very noisy with single pane windows.  Plus people pressing their car locks at 1am.
